yea, I have added generators to the list of things which can be put in 
a scenario and redid one form.  Damn it, though, I am running into 
problems with free memory.  I can't run more than 2 forms at a time, 
which isn't a problem (at least not yet).  I also streamlined lots 
of the code.  By the time I am finished, there will be very little 
functionality that this program won't do, besides create maps and 
assign names to characters.  As soon as I get the current level of 
debugging and testing done, I'll be adjusting things so that you could 
pick which characters could go on which teams.  After I get that 
squared away, I'm going to compile the whole program.  The biggest 
feedback I am looking forward to is making the program more user 
friendly.

Of course, I have not checked the program to see what happens when you 
 enter "0" in certain locations; I am trying to get all the 
functionality fleshed out first.
